bibliographic_data.title: The PRISMA 2020 statement: an updated guideline for reporting systematic reviews

datasets_used: Meta-analysis of systematic review quality studies
Cross-disciplinary validation across medical, social science, and engineering fields

specific_applications: Systematic review methodology framework for WiFi HAR literature analysis
Quality assessment standards for technical paper evaluation
Evidence synthesis methodologies for technology reviews

strengths: Establishes international gold standard for systematic review reporting
Strong methodological foundation based on expert consensus
Significant improvement in review completeness (65% increase)
Wide adoption across multiple disciplines and 500+ journals
Enhances transparency and reproducibility of systematic reviews
limitations: Primarily designed for medical field, requires adaptation for engineering
High implementation cost in terms of time and training required
May be overly rigid for rapidly evolving technical domains
Limited guidance for evaluating algorithm reproducibility and code quality
Does not adequately address preprints and conference papers in tech fields
Potential over-emphasis on process may limit innovative content discovery
future_directions: Development of PRISMA variants for engineering and computer science
Integration of algorithm performance and code quality assessment standards
Adaptation for rapid technology development cycles
Enhanced guidance for preprint and open-source software evaluation
Cross-disciplinary integration frameworks for technology-application reviews
Automated tools for PRISMA compliance checking

wifi_har_relevance.methodological_contribution: Provides rigorous framework for WiFi HAR literature analysis
wifi_har_relevance.quality_assurance: Ensures scientific rigor in systematic technology reviews
wifi_har_relevance.transparency_standards: Establishes reporting standards for comprehensive literature analysis
adaptation_requirements: Dataset quality and experimental setup evaluation
